meanings.definition: The money or resources needed for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: She lacked the wherewithal to buy a new car.
meanings.sent2: He saved up enough wherewithal to start his own business.
meanings.sent3: With the wherewithal in her piggy bank, she dreamt of owning a unicorn.
meanings.sent4: The wherewithal in his wallet was a key to his independence.
meanings.sent5: The wherewithal for a rainy day made her feel secure.

meanings.definition: The means by which something can be accomplished.
meanings.sent1: Education provides the wherewithal to achieve one's goals.
meanings.sent2: Hard work and determination are the wherewithal for success.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand was his wherewithal to make wishes come true.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the wherewithal to brighten up a room.
meanings.sent5: Teamwork is the wherewithal to overcome challenges.
